item.name: public admin invitation routes

request.description:
admin_invitations/{invitation_key} -- 
get information about a given admin invitation;
invitation key is passed  in URL
does not require sign in

admin_invitations/{invitation_key}/accept -- 
accept an admin invitation;
invitation key is passed  in URL
does not require sign in

admin_invitations/{invitation_key}/decline -- 
decline an admin invitation;
invitation key is passed  in URL
does not require sign in

item.description:
public routes related to acceptance of admin invitations;
do not require user sign-in

request.description:
admin/admins/all -- 
get information about all SWAMP users who are admins

admin/projects/all -- 
get information about all SWAMP projects
can add filters to URL;
requires admin sign-in

v1/app_passwords -- 
Get information about all of the signed in user's App Passwords

v1/app_passwords -- 
Delete all of the signed in user's App Passwords

assessment_runs -- create assessment runs;
Project, Package, Tool, and Platform specified in Body.

run_requests -- 
Create a Run Request (Schedule container) for the signed in user;
Project, name, and descriptions are in the Body.
Need to post run_request_schedules for individual schedule times.

formdata.value: a a a a a copy 01

request.description:
packages/owners/{user_uuid} --
Get a list of protected packages owned by a given user; 
the user uuid is provided in the URL.
Note that only the owner can see "secret_token"--for all other users it is "null" even if set in the database.

packages/projects/{project_uuid} --
Get a list of packages shared with a given project and all public packages;
the project uuids are provided in the URL (+ delimited).
Note that only the owner can see "secret_token"--for all other users it is "null" even if set in the database

url.raw: {{csa}}/packages/d6cc773a-dfd6-43d0-7811-3b5229f7f313?name=Android Ant 2&description=based on androidtoken; android sdk target; edited via postman&package_sharing_status=private&package_type_id=6&external_url=https://slop.com/zip.git

query.value: based on androidtoken; android sdk target; edited via postman

item.name: packages/versions/upload (Clone from an External Git URL)
newly uploaded package version file archive inspection routes
newly uploaded package version inspection routes
package version file archive inspection routes

request.description:
packages/versions/build-system/check --
Performs a check of build parameters based on the files existing in the temporary archive file for a new Package Version;
Set Package Build Information parameters in the Body.
Get package_path by combining returned destination_path and file_name from the upload post

proxy-{PROXY_ID}/{any} -- 
Connect to a CodeDX via a proxy

assessment_results/{assessment_result_uuid}/viewer/{viewer_uuid}/project/{project_uuid} -- 
Open a viewer for the given assessessment results/project.
Code DX = 4221533e-865a-11e3-88bb-001a4a81450b
Native Viewer = b7289170-5c46-11e3-9fa4-001a4a81450b
For Code DX, assessment_result_uuid can be 'none' or comma-separated list
Assessment Result, Viewer, and Project are provided in the route URL.

assessment_results/{assessment_result_uuid}/viewer/{viewer_uuid}/project/{project_uuid}/permission -- 
Get the required poliy if the user has not accepted the policy needed to view the given result
Assessment Result, Viewer, and Project are provided in the route URL;
returns an empty set (200 ok) if permission requirements are met or not needed.

assessment_results/viewer/{viewer_uuid}/project/{project_uuid}/permission -- 
Get the required poliy if the user has not accepted the policy needed to open a viewer
Viewer, and Project are provided in the route URL;
currently always returns approved since there is no permission requirement to open a viewer without results

assessment_results/viewer_instance/{viewer_instance_uuid} -- 
Get viewer instance status, and if available, the proxy URL.
Viewer Instance is provided in the route URL.

viewers/all -- 
Get a list of available viewers

users/classes -- 
Get a list of classes available for enrollment

verifications/[verification_key] -- 
Get information about the user associated with the given email verification key (the key is provided in the URL in the verification email)

verifications/verify/{verification_key} -- 
Verify the email address change for the user associated with the verification key (the key is provided in the URL in the verification email)

logout --
Sign out of SWAMP

idps --
Get a list of the CI Login Providers

oauth2/redirect --
Redirect to an oauth2 site to get information needed to sign in or link to a SWAMP account

oauth2/register --
Register a new SWAMP user and link the account to an oauth2 provider;

oauth2/user --
Get user information from an oauth2 provider
